blog.description: President Obama will soon be sworn into office, and whether you voted for him or not, he's everybody's president. What do you want him to remember in his second term? We will feature your responses in our inauguration coverage!
blog.title: Dear Mr. President
blog.name: inauguration2013

posts.caption:
Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

Dear Mr. President,
Greetings! I must say that I am saddended by what is happening to our beloved country. Between people arguing over gun control, immigration, equal rights, the environment and welfare, this country is going to pots.
I am a Democrat who believes in you, but I too feel that people need to get off of welfare and back to work. I happen to know lots of people on welfare, as I am poor too (I am not on welfare, I work as a lunch lady-money is money! And I am in college online) they want to work, they want a job to go to, Im not sure why people all of a sudden are claiming that welfare recipients are all on drugs and dont want to work (were are those statistics by the way?) It is rhetoric to separate our great nation. However, jobs are scarce around here, we need jobs to get people off of welfare! So job creation is on top of my list.
I dont care if people want to own a gun for safety. But why own a weapon of mass distruction? These automatic weapons are unecessary, I hear people talk on Facebook about how they dont want their 2nd Amendment to be compramised, that they want to “protect” their families and some go hunting. Thats fine, but automatic weapons? Are they planning on taking out the whole herd at once when hunting? And theives who break into houses or hold people up are only 1 to 2 people at a time, so a semi automatic weapon is again unecessary. I will not own a gun, the chances/odds of me needing one or being in the right place at the right time to use one is slim to none. We do have crime in my town of 50,000 plus people, but seriously, its not that bad! I own a dog, theives tend to hit easy targets, not challenging ones. Besides, I dont have anything worth taking. Too bad the horses are already out of the barn, we cant close the doors now, these weapons are out in the public. Pure machismo/penile extention and Looky what kind of gun I got! Please help to control this issue.
The environment is a big issue for me as well, do you know we have several garbage patches in the oceans? We are abusing our planet and we have no other planet to go to! Also, Stricter punishments for animal abusers, these sick individuals need to actually learn a lesson and be removed from society. You can learn alot about a person when you see how they treat animals.
I can understand the struggle of people in other countries trying to come here and live, I feel for them, but I agree, they need to do it legally. Even though we are all immigrants, we must go about it legally. And equal rights for all is still a big issue here in the States, not just for different races, but for the GLBT communities as well. We need to continue to work on equal rights for all.
I think your doing a great job, it is hard to make changes for the greater good when you have people standing in your way. Good luck, and please stick to YOUR plans, stand up to the ones that are making decisions that are bad for our country. This separation of poor v rich is going to destroy our country. Put that foot down, you can do it!
Take care.

Signed,
Cris from Chicago

Dear Mr. President,

I didn’t vote for you.

We Americans have the right to own firearms, to include AR-15’s. It is both illogical and absurd to use the tragedy that unfolded in Newtown Connecticut as a reason for needing an ban on assault weapons. Chicago, your favorite city, has some of the most strict gun laws in the country and non-coincidentally had 516 murders last year. Removing guns from the homes of law abiding citizens will only make Americans more vulnerable to harm done unto us by NON-law abiding who could care less if you establish a assault weapons ban.

Signed,
Victor G Crespo from Jacksonville, Florida

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

I’m concerned that we are allowing politicians and talk radio mouths to obfuscate scientific evidence. Science is losing credibility because the aforementioned are given the platform to express their mere opinions. We need a leader that is not afraid of being outspoken on the importance and credibility of science.

Climate change is real. Evolution is real. We need these concepts understood in order to make the necessary change needed to sustain this planet.

Please help us show the world, through leadership and action, that we trust in science.

Signed,
Mike Bosko from Ellensburg, WA

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

I had to live in fear for years that my husband would be deported. I would have had to drop out of school and leave the country I was born in to be with him. Current immigration laws encourage illegal immigration. Why does it take 12+ years for paperwork to be processed for law abiding immigrants? Why does it cost thousands of dollars to file one piece of paper? Deport criminals, don’t split up good hard-working students and families!

Signed,
Virginia from Richmond, CA

Dear Mr. President,

I didn’t vote for you.

I voted for you in 2008 expecting you to make much more progress towards addressing environmental issues. I am glad you’ve created so many subsidies towards wind energy and solar. But there are other options besides these and the progress that has been made so far is still far from sufficient. Please make addressing climate change and renewable energy the top priority this term. I would like my future children to be able to grow up in a world that is not doomed to extreme weather, food and water shortages, and a degraded environment.

Please also do not cater to Monsanto and other “big ag” corporations. Make foods containing GMO’s labeled. All of us want to know what we’re really eating. You’re not doing anyone any favors by valuing profit more than your constituents’ health. And don’t appoint people that used to work for corporations like Monsanto as chiefs of our federal agencies.

And finally, fix Congress. Getting rid of the gridlock will make addressing all those things I mentioned above a whole lot easier.

Signed,
Anja from Cullowhee, NC

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

We’re advanced, we’re civilized, we’re thinking, caring people, and we’re capable of preventing unnecessary deaths. Please encourage governors to pardon prisoners sentenced to death and please stop drone strikes in civilian areas. Please eliminate the use of the phrase “collateral damage” when referencing non-combatant casualties.

Signed,
Tess Banta from Brooklyn, NY

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

My husband died when our son was a baby. In the nine years since, I have paid Christian school tuition and medical insurance and doctor bills on a single mom’s income. Few understand the effort and sacrifice it takes to raise a child responsibly… but I believe you do, Mr. President. I believe you not only acknowledge, but take great comfort in the ability and courage of the American people. As a nation and as individuals, we will face trials of all sorts. But we are strong.

Signed,
Jodi MacNeal from Palm Beach Gardens, FL

Dear Mr. President,

I didn’t vote for you.

I voted for you the first time, and then I didn’t vote for you the second.

My taxes just went up, which is ok with me if our national debt goes down. Unfortunately, that wish just doesn’t look promising from here. We haven’t had a government that believes in creating a budget which pays off what it owes in a very very very long time.

Lets create a culture of government that allows it’s citizens to be diverse in walk of life and belief, instead of creating legislation that tries to force everyone to into the same mold.

Signed,
Dietrich from Idaho

Dear Mr. President,

I voted for you.

The disabled are drowning. Please push for better services. Especially for the 95% of the mentally ill, whom are NOT violent!

Signed,
Veronica B Vale from Pleasant Hill, CA.

Dear Mr. President,

I didn’t vote for you.

Dear Mr president,

Congratulations on your ability to make people believe there is a difference between political parties! That was a great joke, almost as good as comparing yourself to Lincoln!

We are now all fully enjoying the Orwellian utopia you and your corporate masters are creating for us. Thanks for signing the NDAA, your mismanagement of the economy, and for considering banning guns, and expanding your secret wars, real thoughtful of you. We all feel so much safer thanks to GW Bush and your efforts to restrict our freedoms in the name of freedom.

In closing, I hope you get painful ass cancer as a reward for all your efforts.

Signed,
Paul from Sioux City Ia
